member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.HeaderRowDetector
member.summary: Improved header row detector with a more modular pattern evaluation system.

member.summary: Determines if the first row of a sheet is a header row by analyzing patterns in the data.
member.param: List of rows from the sheet.
The shared string table for the workbook.
Maximum number of rows to analyze (default 10).

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.HeaderRowResult
member.summary: Result object from detection of existence of a header row.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.HeaderRowResult.IsHeaderRow
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the first row is a header row.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.HeaderRowResult.#ctor
member.summary: Result object from detection of existence of a header row.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.XlsxProcessor
member.summary: Create atoms from Microsoft Excel .xlsx documents.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.XlsxProcessor.BuildHierarchy(System.Collections.Generic.List{DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom})
member.summary: Build hierarchical structure from flat list of atoms. Groups atoms by PageNumber (sheet number), making the first atom on each page the parent.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.XlsxProcessorSettings.CommonHeaderRowTerms
member.summary: Terms to search for when identifying header rows.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.XlsxProcessorSettings.HeaderRowWeights
member.summary: Pattern weights for header row detection.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Excel.XlsxProcessorSettings.BuildHierarchy
member.summary: Enable or disable hierarchical structure building. When true, atoms will be organized in a tree structure based on sheet (page) grouping. When false, atoms will be returned as a flat list. Default is true.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessor
member.summary: Create atoms from images. Use of this processor requires that Tesseract be installed on the host.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessor.#ctor(DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings)
member.summary: Create atoms from images. Use of this processor requires that Tesseract be installed on the host.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings
member.summary: Settings for image processor. Use of this processor requires that Tesseract be installed on the host.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.TesseractDataDirectory
member.summary: Tesseract data directory (the tessdata folder). On Windows, the folder is usually in C:\Program Files\Tesseract-OCR\tessdata or C:\Program Files(x86)\Tesseract-OCR\tessdata. On Ubuntu, the folder is usually in /usr/share/tesseract-ocr/4.00/tessdata or /usr/local/share/tessdata. On Mac, the folder is usually in /usr/local/share/tessdata or /opt/homebrew/share/tessdata.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.TesseractLanguage
member.summary: Tesseract trained language file, i.e. {language}.traineddata in the tessdata folder.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.LineThreshold
member.summary: The vertical distance threshold (in pixels) used to group text elements into lines. Default value is 5 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will make the extractor more tolerant of vertical spacing variations. Decreasing it will enforce stricter line grouping.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.ParagraphThreshold
member.summary: The vertical distance threshold (in pixels) used to identify paragraph breaks. Default value is 30 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will merge more text blocks into single paragraphs. Decreasing it will create more paragraph breaks.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.HorizontalLineLength
member.summary: The minimum length (in pixels) required to identify a horizontal line in tables. Default value is 80 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will require longer lines for table detection. Decreasing it may detect more table-like structures.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.VerticalLineLength
member.summary: The minimum length (in pixels) required to identify a vertical line in tables. Default value is 40 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will require taller lines for table detection. Decreasing it may detect more table-like structures.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.TableMinArea
member.summary: The minimum area (in square pixels) required for a region to be considered a table. Default value is 5000 pixels². Minimum value is 1 pixel². Increasing this value will only detect larger tables. Decreasing it may detect smaller table-like structures.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.ColumnAlignmentTolerance
member.summary: The horizontal pixel tolerance for aligning elements into columns. Default value is 10 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will be more lenient in column alignment. Decreasing it will enforce stricter column alignment.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.ProximityThreshold
member.summary: The distance threshold (in pixels) used to determine if elements are related. Default value is 20 pixels. Minimum value is 1 pixel. Increasing this value will group more distant elements together. Decreasing it will create more separate groups.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.ListMarkers
member.summary: The collection of characters used to identify list items in the text. Default includes common bullet point and list markers. Adding markers will allow detection of additional list styles. Removing markers will limit list detection.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.ListNumberingPatterns
member.summary: Collection of regular expression patterns used to identify numbered list items. Default patterns include common formats like "1.", "a)", "(1)", "i.", etc. Adding patterns will enable detection of additional numbering styles. Removing patterns will limit detection of those styles.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Settings for image processor. Use of this processor requires that Tesseract be installed on the host.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Ocr.ImageContentExtractor
member.summary: Image context entractor. This library requires that you have Tesseract installed on the host and that you have awareness of the location of the tessdata directory.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Ocr.ImageContentExtractor.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Image context entractor. This library requires that you have Tesseract installed on the host and that you have awareness of the location of the tessdata directory.
member.param: Tesseract data folder. For Windows, the folder is generally C:\Program Files\Tesseract-OCR\tessdata. For MacOS, the folder is generally /usr/local/share/tessdata or /opt/local/share/tessdata. For Linux, the folder is generally /usr/share/tessdata or /usr/local/share/tessdata.
The default language file to use. Defaults to eng. This file, with extension .traineddata, must exist in the data directory.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Ocr.ListStructure.IsOrdered
member.summary: Boolean indicating if the list is ordered.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Pdf.PdfRegion.Processed
member.summary: Boolean indicating if the region was processed.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Pdf.PdfListRegion.IsOrdered
member.summary: Boolean indicating if the list is ordered.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.PowerPoint.PptxProcessor
member.summary: Create atoms from Microsoft PowerPoint .pptx documents.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.PowerPoint.PptxProcessor.BuildHierarchy(System.Collections.Generic.List{DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom})
member.summary: Build hierarchical structure from flat list of atoms. Groups atoms by PageNumber, making the first atom on each page the parent.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.PowerPoint.PptxProcessorSettings.BuildHierarchy
member.summary: Enable or disable hierarchical structure building. When true, atoms will be organized in a tree structure based on slide (page) grouping. When false, atoms will be returned as a flat list. Default is true.

member.summary: Dispose of managed and unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.RichText.RtfProcessor.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose of all resources used by the RTF processor.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.RichText.RtfProcessor.#ctor(DocumentAtom.Documents.RichText.RtfProcessorSettings,DocumentAtom.Documents.Image.ImageProcessorSettings)
member.param: RTF processor settings, defaults to new instance if null.

member.summary: Extract atoms from an RTF file.

member.returns: Enumerable collection of atoms representing document structure and content.
member.exception: Thrown when filename is null or empty.

member.summary: Retrieve metadata from an RTF file.

member.exception: Thrown when filename is null or empty.

member.name: T:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor
member.summary: Create atoms from Microsoft Word .docx documents.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor.BuildHierarchy(System.Collections.Generic.List{DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom})
member.summary: Build hierarchical structure from flat list of atoms.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor.FindParentHeader(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom},System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the parent header for a given header level. Returns the nearest header with level less than the specified level.
member.param: Dictionary of current headers by level.
Header level to find parent for.
member.returns: Parent header atom, or null if no parent exists.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor.FindDeepestHeader(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom})
member.summary: Find the deepest (highest level number) current header.
member.param: Dictionary of current headers by level.
member.returns: Deepest header atom, or null if no headers exist.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor.ClearDeeperLevels(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,DocumentAtom.Core.Atoms.Atom},System.Int32)
member.summary: Clear tracking for header levels deeper than the specified level.
member.param: Dictionary of current headers by level.

member.name: M:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessor.GetHeadingLevel(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Wordprocessing.Paragraph)
member.summary: Get the heading level from a paragraph's style.
member.returns: Heading level (1-9) or null if not a heading.

member.name: P:DocumentAtom.Documents.Word.DocxProcessorSettings.BuildHierarchy
member.summary: Enable or disable hierarchical structure building. When true, atoms will be organized in a tree structure based on heading styles (Heading 1, Heading 2, etc.). When false, atoms will be returned as a flat list. Default is true.
